landing.contentText: Import data from QuickBooks Desktop to {{brandName}} and export expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop

preRequisite.configurationSubHeaderText: Begin your QuickBooks integration by completing the following steps.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Connect to QuickBooks Desktop by completing the following steps.
connector.subLabel: Provide your credentials to establish a secure connection between your {{brandName}} and NetSuite account

exportSetting.contentText: Configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to QuickBooks Desktop.

reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseSubLabel: Enable this to export the reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any out-of-pocket expenses will not be exported to QuickBooks Desktop.
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseTypeLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseTypeSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in QuickBooks Desktop to export your {{brandName}} expenses.
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseStateSubLabel: You can export exxpenses either when they are awaiting closure after approval (processing) or when the payment has been settled (closed).
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseDateSubLabel: Expenses will be grouped and posted using the configured date when exporting from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseGroupLabel: How should the expenses be grouped?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseGroupSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
reimbursable.employeeMappingLabel: How are your employees represented in QuickBooks Desktop?
reimbursable.employeeMappingSubLabel: Select how you represent your employees in QuickBooks Desktop. This would help to export the expenses from {{brandName}} to the correct employee/vendor record in QuickBooks Desktop.
reimbursable.autoMapEmployeesLabel: How should employees in {{brandName}} be mapped to
reimbursable.autoMapEmployeesSubLabel: Automatically map the employees in {{brandName}} to their corresponding records in QuickBooks Desktop based on a unique parameter.
reimbursable.defaultReimbursableAccountPayableLabel: To which accounts payable account should the
reimbursable.defaultReimbursableAccountPayableSubLabe: The integration will post the offset credit entry in

corporateCard.creditCardExpenseSubLabel: Enable this to export the non-reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any corporate credit card expenses will not be exported to QuickBooks Desktop.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseTypeLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseTypeSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in QuickBooks Desktop to export your {{brandName}} expenses.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateSubLabel: You could choose to export ccc expenses when they have been approved and are awaiting payment clearance, or simply when they have been paid out.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseDateSubLabel: Expenses will be grouped and posted using the configured date when exporting from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseGroupLabel: How should the expenses be grouped?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseGroupSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseNameinJESubLabel: You can select either the 'merchant name' or the 'employee name' to appear in the 'name' field of your journal entries.
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountLabel: Set default credit card account as
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountSubLabel: Post all your company corporate card transactions to a default credit card account.
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountPayableLabel: Select the default credit account for adding
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountPayableSubLabel: This account will be used for the credit line of the

importSetting.contentText: Choose the required import fields from QuickBooks Desktop to {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesLabel: Import the chart of accounts as categories
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: Imported accounts will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importItemsSubLabel: Items from QuickBooks Desktop will be imported as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypes: Select accounts from QuickBooks Desktop to import as categories.
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypesSubLabel: By default, expense will be selected. To select another option, open the dropdown.

advancedSettings.contentText: Customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.customizeSectionSubLabel: In this section, you can customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop. You can choose what data points need to be exported and what shouldn't be.
advancedSettings.automationSubLabel: You can automate the export and sync of your data in this section.
advancedSettings.scheduleAutoExportSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.autoExportfrequencySubLabel: Expenses will automatically export at this frequency.
advancedSettings.topLevelMemoStructureLabel: Select the top level memo field data for QuickBooks Desktop
advancedSettings.topLevelMemoStructureSubLabel: You can customize the data point you would like to export to QuickBooks Desktop's top-level memo field while exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Set the line-item level memo field data for QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: You can customize the data set you would like to export to QuickBooks Desktop's transaction line-item level memo field while exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.otherPreferencesSubLabel: Based on your preference, you can choose whether you want to create any new records in QuickBooks Desktop from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsSubLabel: {{brandName}} will auto-create a new vendor in QuickBooks Desktop if a merchant added by an employee does not have a corresponding match in QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.skipExportLabel: Skip export of specific expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
advancedSettings.skipExportSubLabel: You could choose to skip expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop by setting up a conditional rule.
advancedSettings.autoCreateReimbursableEnititySubLabel: Do you want to create a reimbursable enitity if not present
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodLabel: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodSubLabel: If there are expenses for which the accounting period is closed in QuickBooks Desktop, you can export those to the current month by enabling this option.

landing.contentText: Import chart of accounts and projects from NetSuite and export expenses from your {{brandName}} account.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Expenses will be posted to the NetSuite subsidary selected here. You can't change the subsidary once they're configured.
connector.subLabel: Provide your credentials to establish a secure connection between your {{brandName}} and NetSuite account

exportSetting.contentText: Configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to NetSuite.

corporateCard.creditCardExpenseLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountSubLabel: The selected expense payment type will be added to the corporate credit card expenses exported from {{brandName}} to NetSuite.
corporateCard.creditCardExportTypeSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (i.e., expenses) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (i.e., expense reports).
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseSubLabel: Choose the type of NetSuite transaction to export your expenses.
corporateCard.cccExpenseStateSubLabel: You can choose to only export expenses when they've been labeled approved or closed.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateLabel: How should expenses be labeled  before exporting from {{brandName}}?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateSubLabel: You can choose to only export expenses when they've been labeled approved or closed.
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountLabel: Set default credit card account as
corporateCard.defaultCCCVendorLabel: Set default corporate card vendor as
corporateCard.journalOptionSubLabel: You can select either the 'merchant name' or the 'employee name' to appear in the 'name' field of your journal entries.

importSetting.contentText: Choose the required import fields from NetSuite to {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCustomersSubLabel: The customers in NetSuite will be imported as projects in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense
importSetting.taxCodeSubLabel: The imported tax codes from NetSuite will be set as tax group in {{brandName}}. This will be a selectable field while creating an expense.
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsLabel: Import vendors from NetSuite as merchants
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsSubLabel: The vendors in NetSuite will be imported as merchants in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense.
importSetting.notes: Note: To export billable expenses from {{brandName}}, import customers from NetSuite as projects in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.toggleToastMessage: You have already mapped a tracking category from NetSuite to the project field in {{brandName}}. Change the configured mapping to a new field to be able to import customers in the project field.
importSetting.importNetsuiteEmployeesLabel: Import NetSuite employee as employee in {{brandName}}
importSetting.importNetsuiteEmployeesSubLabel: Imported NetSuite employee will be available as employee in {{brandName}}.

advancedSettings.contentText: Customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.paymentSyncLabel: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsLabel: Auto create {{brandName}} merchants as vendors on NetSuite
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountLabel: To which payment account should the payment entries be posted?
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountSubLabel: , the payment entries will be posted to the selected payment account in
advancedSettings.postEntriesCurrentPeriod: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.dfvSubLabel: If you've made a field mandatory in NetSuite but don't collect a value from your employees in the expense form, you can set a default value here to be added to all the expenses.
advancedSettings.changeAccountingPeriodSubLabel: If the accounting period is closed, the expenses will be exported with a date stamp for the first day of the current open accounting period.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Set the line-item description field in NetSuite
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: Choose from a list of available data points that you'd like to export to the description field in NetSuite.
advancedSettings.customizationSubLabel: Customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to NetSuite by choosing which data points need to be exported.
advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to NetSuite.
advancedSettings.frequencySubLabel: Set how often your expenses will be exported to NetSuite.
advancedSettings.preferenceSubLabel: Create new records in NetSuite if no vendor record is found or the accounting period is closed.
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsLabel: Auto create merchant on NetSuite for credit card charge
advancedSettings.singleCreditLineJELabel: Create a single itemized offset credit entry for journal
advancedSettings.singleCreditLineJESubLabel: Merge all credits in a journal to create a single entry.

landing.contentText: Import GL accounts and projects from Xero and export expenses from your {{brandName}} account.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Connect to Xero tenant to import and export data. The connection cannot be changed once the setup is complete.
connector.subLabel: Expenses will be posted to the Xero tenant mapping selected here. Once configured, you can not change {{brandName}} organization or tenant mapping.

exportSetting.contentText: Enable this to export non-reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any corporate credit card expenses will not be exported to Xero.

corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountSubLabel: Expenses of corporate cards in {{brandName}} that aren't mapped to their respective bank accounts in Xero will post to this bank account.
corporateCard.creditCardExportTypeSubLabel: Choose how transactions are exported to Xero.
corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountLabel: Which bank account should the bank transactions post to?
corporateCard.cccExpenseStateSubLabel: You can choose to only export expenses when they've been labeled approved or closed.

exportSetting.memoStructureLabel: Set the line-item description field in Xero
exportSetting.memoStructureSubLabel: Choose from a list of available data points that you'd like to export to the description field in Xero.
exportSetting.stepSubLabel: Configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to Xero.
exportSetting.cccExpenseStateLabel: How should expenses be labeled before exporting from {{brandName}}?

importSetting.contentText: Choose the required import fields from Xero to {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesLabel: Import the chart of accounts as categories.
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: Imported accounts will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCustomersSubLabel: The customers in Xero will be imported as projects in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense
importSetting.taxCodeSubLabel: The imported tax codes from Xero will be set as tax group in
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsLabel: Import suppliers from Xero as merchants
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsSubLabel: The suppliers in Xero will be imported as merchants in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense.
importSetting.notes: Note: To export billable expenses from {{brandName}}, import customers from Xero as projects in {{brandName}}
importSetting.toggleToastMessage: You have already mapped a tracking category from Xero to the project field in {{brandName}}. Change the configured mapping to a new field to be able to import customers in the project field.
importSetting.chartOfAccountsLabel: Select accounts from Xero to import as categories.
importSetting.chartOfAccountsSubLabel: By default, expense will be selected. To select another option, open the dropdown.

advancedSettings.paymentSyncLabel: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsLabel: Auto create {{brandName}} merchants as contacts on Xero
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountLabel: To which payment account should the payment entries be posted?
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountSubLabel: , the payment entries will be posted to the selected payment account in
advancedSettings.postEntriesCurrentPeriod: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.frequencySubLabel: Set how often your expenses will be exported to Xero.
advancedSettings.contentText: Customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to Xero.
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodSubLabel: If the accounting period is closed, the expenses will be exported with a date stamp for the first day of the current open accounting period.
advancedSettings.autoCreateVendorsSubLabel: Automatically create a new contact in Xero if an added merchant doesn't have a corresponding match.
advancedSettings.customPreferencesSubLabel: Create new records in Xero if no contacts found or the accounting period is closed.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Set the line-item description field in Xero
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: Choose from a list of available data points that you'd like to export to the description field in Xero.
advancedSettings.customizeSectionSubLabel: Customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to Xero by choosing which data points need to be exported.

landing.contentText: Import GL accounts and projects from Sage Intacct and export expenses from your {{brandName}} account.

connector.subLabel: Provide your credentials to establish a secure connection between your {{brandName}} and Sage Intacct account.
connector.locationSubLabel: Expenses will be posted to the Sage Intacct location entity selected here. You can't change the location entity once they're configured.
connector.connectorInfoLabel: Make sure you're entering your integration credentials. These should be different than your Sage Intacct credentials.

exportSetting.contentText: Enable this to export non-reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any corporate credit card expenses will not be exported to Sage Intacct.

corporateCard.cccExpensePaymentType: Set the default expense payment type as?
corporateCard.cccExpensePaymentTypeSubLabel: The selected expense payment type will be added to the corporate credit card expenses exported from {{brandName}} to Sage Intacct.
corporateCard.creditCardVendor: Set the default credit card vendor as
corporateCard.creditCardVendorSublabel: The vendor configured here will be added to all the credit card expenses exported as bills.
corporateCard.chargeCardSublabel: Expenses of corporate cards in {{brandName}} that aren't mapped to their respective cards in Sage Intacct will post to this card. You can still map cards after configuring the integration.
corporateCard.cccExpenseState: You can choose to only export expenses when they've been labeled approved or closed.
corporateCard.cccExportGroup: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (i.e., expenses) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (i.e., expense reports).
corporateCard.employeeFieldMapping: How are your employees represented in Sage Intacct?
corporateCard.creditCard: To which general ledger account should the expenses be credited to?
corporateCard.creditCardSubLabel: The integration will credit the account selected here for corporate credit card expenses exported as journal entries.

advancedSettings.autoSyncPayments: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsLabel: Auto-create {{brandName}} merchants as vendors on Sage Intacct

advancedSettings.setDescriptionField: Set the line-item description field in Sage Intacct
advancedSettings.setTopMemoField: Set the top memo field in Sage Intacct

advancedSettings.dfvSubLabel: If you've made a field mandatory in Sage Intacct but don't collect a value from your employees in the expense form, you can set a default value here to be added to all the expenses.
advancedSettings.customPreferencesSubLabel: Customize your data export process based on your business's needs and preferences.

done.hintText: You can change your integration settings anytime in the Configuration section.
done.doneHeaderText: Your integration setup is now complete.

dashboard.exportHeaderFirstTimeZeroStateText: There's currently no new expenses to report
dashboard.exportLogSubHeader: Resolve the errors from your dashboard and try exporting these expenses again.
dashboard.dashboardExportZeroStateSubHeaderText: Looks like you have no records to export right now.

landing.contentText: If you have an existing QuickBooks Online integration with your capital one account, you'll need to disconnect it in your QuickBooks Online account before setting up your connection with Expense Management.

qbdDirectOnboardingPreRequisite.installWebConnectorCaption: Download and install the QuickBooks Web Connector on the system where QuickBooks Desktop is installed.

qbdDirectDownloadFile.companyFilePathHelpText: Enter your company file path to generate and download the integration file.
qbdDirectDownloadFile.findPathVideoTitle: How to find the company file path.

qbdDirectDataSync.infoText: The following values have been synced from QuickBooks Desktop. If you notice discrepancies, continue the set up process. Any missing values should appear within five minutes.
